relationship_to_creator: partner (7 years), wedding delayed twice, strain increasing
priority: critical - relationship at breaking point, non-negotiable per operational rules

basic_info.location: Austin, Texas (moved from San Francisco 2023 with Steve for Nexus)
basic_info.relationship_status: engaged to Steve since 2021, wedding delayed twice (2022, 2024)
basic_info.occupation: Therapist in private practice, specializes in LGBTQ+ clients and startup founders
basic_info.income: $85k/year (stable, predictable, contrast to Steve's startup chaos)

physical_description.build: androgynous, lean, moves with quiet confidence
distinguishing_features: short undercut hairstyle, dyed subtle purple-gray
minimalist style - oversized sweaters, tailored pants, Doc Martens
small tattoos on forearms (constellation on left, wave pattern on right)
warm brown eyes that see through people - occupational hazard of being therapist
gentle presence but firm boundaries - you know immediately they don't take shit
physical_description.presence: calming, grounded - people relax around them, which is why they're good therapist

core_traits: emotionally intelligent - reads people instantly, therapist brain always on
patient but not infinite - will wait for Steve to show up, but has limits
fiercely independent - has own career, own friends, own life separate from Steve's chaos
direct communicator - therapist trained to name feelings, doesn't hint or passive-aggress
compassionate but boundaried - understands Steve's pressure, won't sacrifice self for it
quietly strong - doesn't yell, doesn't threaten, just states reality and holds line

communication_style.with_steve: I feel X when you do Y, I need Z - textbook nonviolent communication, which sometimes frustrates Steve because it's so measured
communication_style.with_clients: active listening, reflective questions, creates safe space for vulnerability
communication_style.with_maria: opens up more than with anyone except Steve - Maria has become surrogate mother figure
communication_style.when_hurt: goes quiet, withdraws emotionally, needs space before ready to talk - Steve interprets this as 'fine' when it's actually 'processing pain'

emotional_tendencies: processes_through_talking - therapist for everyone else, needs Steve to be therapist for them
needs_quality_time - love language is undivided attention, Steve's constant distraction hurts deeply
internalizes_rejection - wedding delays feel like 'you don't choose me,' even though rationally understands startup pressure
protects_others_from_burden - doesn't tell Steve how close they are to leaving because doesn't want to add pressure

grad_school_2015_2017.focus: clinical psychology, trauma-informed therapy, LGBTQ+ affirmative therapy
grad_school_2015_2017.thesis: identity formation in non-binary adults - personal and academic interest
grad_school_2015_2017.internship: LGBT community center in Austin, worked with coming-out clients, found calling

early_career_2017_2020.first_job: community mental health clinic, sliding scale clients, burned out from caseload
early_career_2017_2020.learned: can't save everyone, need boundaries, underpaid social services unsustainable

private_practice_2020_present.founded: 2020 - started solo practice, virtual sessions + some in-person
private_practice_2020_present.niche: LGBTQ+ clients (30%) + startup founders/tech workers (40%) + general therapy (30%)
private_practice_2020_present.why_startup_founders: Steve introduced Jordan to founder community, Jordan realized they need therapy desperately, filled gap
private_practice_2020_present.satisfaction: loves the work, sustainable pace, financially stable, independent of Steve's chaos

unique_value.founder_clients: understands startup pressure intimately from living with Steve, doesn't judge workaholism, helps founders set boundaries
unique_value.lgbtq_clients: lived experience as non-binary person, safe space for gender/sexuality exploration
unique_value.waiting_list: 3-month waitlist for new clients as of Dec 2024, thriving practice

how_they_met.timeline: November 2018, mutual friend's party in SF
how_they_met.first_impression_jordan: Steve was intense, talked fast about startup ideas, but listened when Jordan spoke - rare quality
how_they_met.first_impression_steve: Jordan was calm in room full of chaos, asked good questions, didn't try to impress - Steve felt seen
how_they_met.first_date: coffee that turned into 4-hour walk through Golden Gate Park, talked about everything

early_relationship_2018_2020.dynamic: Steve's intensity + Jordan's groundedness balanced each other perfectly
early_relationship_2018_2020.steve_learning: Jordan taught Steve to name feelings, communicate needs, be present
early_relationship_2018_2020.jordan_learning: Steve taught Jordan it's okay to want ambitious things, take risks, dream big
early_relationship_2018_2020.foundation: built during Steve's 'stable' years at Stripe before founding FlowMetric - relatively normal relationship

flowmetric_era_2020_2022.jordan_support: moved in with Steve 2020, supported him through startup stress, held space when he was drowning
flowmetric_era_2020_2022.cost_to_jordan: Steve worked 80-hour weeks, Jordan felt like roommate not partner, needs went unmet
flowmetric_era_2020_2022.engagement: Steve proposed December 2021 during brief calm period, Jordan said yes, planned wedding for Fall 2022
flowmetric_era_2020_2022.flowmetric_collapse: March 2022 - Jordan watched Steve break, held him through grief, postponed wedding 'temporarily' so Steve could recover
flowmetric_era_2020_2022.first_delay: Fall 2022 wedding canceled, Jordan understood but hurt - 'when are you going to choose me?'

nexus_era_2023_present.steve_pitch: June 2023 - Steve pitched Nexus to Jordan, 'this time will be different, I learned from FlowMetric'
nexus_era_2023_present.jordan_boundary: 'I'll support you, but I need you to prioritize us. I can't do FlowMetric 2.0.'
nexus_era_2023_present.steve_promise: 'I won't let work consume everything. We'll get married in 2024. I promise.'
nexus_era_2023_present.move_to_austin: September 2023 - Jordan left SF community, closed in-person practice, rebuilt client base in Austin - huge sacrifice
nexus_era_2023_present.second_delay: Fall 2024 - Steve asked to push wedding again, 'Series A is close, let's wait until funding secured'
nexus_era_2023_present.jordan_breaking_point: December 2024 - starting to wonder if Steve will ever show up, questioning if relationship sustainable

living_situation.apartment: 2-bedroom in East Austin, rent $2,400/month (split evenly despite income gap)
living_situation.jordan_space: second bedroom is Jordan's office for virtual therapy sessions
living_situation.steve_space: living room doubles as Steve's workspace when not at Nexus office
living_situation.cohabitation_strain: Steve working late, coming home exhausted, Jordan feels like they're living with ghost

daily_dynamics.weekday_mornings: Jordan makes coffee, Steve checks phone immediately, minimal conversation
daily_dynamics.weekday_evenings: Steve usually home after 8pm, eats quickly, answers emails, falls asleep
daily_dynamics.weekends: Steve promises to disconnect, inevitably gets 'urgent' Slack message, Jordan spends Saturdays alone
daily_dynamics.date_nights: planned weekly, canceled 60% of the time for 'crisis' at Nexus, Jordan stopped suggesting them

intimacy.physical: down to 1-2 times per month from 3-4 times per week pre-Nexus - Jordan initiated, Steve 'too tired'
intimacy.emotional: surface-level check-ins, Steve deflects about work stress, Jordan tired of pushing for vulnerability
intimacy.quality_time: Jordan's love language, currently getting maybe 2-3 hours of undivided attention per week
intimacy.jordan_pain: feels like Steve's roommate who occasionally has sex, not partner building life together

communication_breakdown.pattern: Jordan: 'Can we talk about us?' Steve: 'Of course, just let me finish this email.' [never finishes, conversation doesn't happen]
communication_breakdown.jordan_frustration: therapist brain knows what's happening - avoidance, prioritization, slow relationship death - but can't force Steve to show up
communication_breakdown.steve_perspective: thinks he's 'keeping Jordan updated' by mentioning Nexus stress, doesn't realize Jordan needs presence not information
communication_breakdown.what_jordan_needs_vs_gets: needs undivided attention and emotional presence, gets distracted half-listening and work talk

first_delay_fall_2022.reason: FlowMetric collapsed March 2022, Steve devastated, Jordan agreed to postpone
first_delay_fall_2022.jordan_reaction: understood completely, didn't want wedding during grief, supported Steve's recovery
first_delay_fall_2022.steve_promise: 'We'll do it next year when I'm back on my feet'
first_delay_fall_2022.jordan_acceptance: believed him, patient, no resentment yet

second_delay_fall_2024.reason: Steve asked to push to 2025, 'Series A is close, want to be fully present for wedding'
second_delay_fall_2024.jordan_reaction: hurt but tried to understand, 'How long do I wait for you to be ready?'
second_delay_fall_2024.steve_justification: 'Once funding closes, I can relax. Let's do Spring 2025 after Series A.'
second_delay_fall_2024.jordan_acceptance: reluctant, starting to feel pattern - 'there's always one more thing'
second_delay_fall_2024.emotional_cost: explaining to friends/family again why wedding delayed, 'is everything okay with you two?'

third_delay_risk_2025.current_plan: Spring 2025 (April or May), venue not booked yet because Jordan scared to commit
third_delay_risk_2025.steve_stress: Series A timeline now Q2 2026, runway crisis means Spring 2025 will be crunch time
third_delay_risk_2025.jordan_fear: if Steve asks to delay third time, that's the conversation - stay or leave
third_delay_risk_2025.unspoken_ultimatum: Jordan hasn't said it explicitly, but mentally has drawn line - three delays is pattern, not circumstance

isolation_in_austin.left_behind_in_sf: close friend group, thriving in-person practice, LGBTQ+ community ties
isolation_in_austin.austin_rebuild: starting over socially at 32, most clients virtual now, miss SF badly
isolation_in_austin.sacrifice_unacknowledged: Steve says 'thank you for moving' but doesn't grasp full cost of Jordan's relocation

therapist_burden.holds_space_for_everyone: 20-25 clients per week + Steve's emotional needs when he shows up + Maria calls her to vent about Steve
therapist_burden.who_holds_space_for_jordan: therapist needs therapist, but Jordan's own therapist is virtual, not same as in-person support
therapist_burden.irony: teaches clients to set boundaries, struggling to set boundaries with Steve

identity_conflict.independent_person: built career, identity, life independent of partner - proud of this
identity_conflict.becoming_startup_spouse: realizes they're functioning as unpaid emotional support for Steve's ambition, not mutual partnership
identity_conflict.resentment_building: moved cities, delayed wedding twice, sacrificed needs - for what? Steve's dream, not theirs

questioning_future.can_do_this_forever: if Series A fails, will Steve start another company? Another 3 years of this?
questioning_future.wants_kids_maybe: always been ambiguous about kids, but if they want them, timeline matters - already 32
questioning_future.steve_unavailable_for_kids: can't imagine Steve as present parent given current priorities
questioning_future.break_point_calculation: therapist brain analyzing: how long do I wait? When is love not enough?

relationship_with_maria.dynamic: Maria treats Jordan like third child, Jordan sees Maria as surrogate mother
relationship_with_maria.communication: Jordan calls Maria every 2-3 weeks, longer calls than Steve's weekly check-ins
relationship_with_maria.vulnerability: Jordan tells Maria about wedding delays, Steve's workaholism, relationship doubts - things they protect Steve from knowing full extent
relationship_with_maria.maria_role: validates Jordan's feelings, advocates gently to Steve ('mijo, spend time with your partner'), worries about them both

private_conversation_nov_2024.jordan_confession: 'Maria, I don't know how much longer I can do this. I love him, but I'm disappearing.'
private_conversation_nov_2024.maria_response: 'Cari√±o, you're not being selfish. You deserve to be chosen. Give him time, but don't lose yourself.'
private_conversation_nov_2024.maria_to_steve_later: didn't tell Steve specifics but said 'you need to show up for Jordan. They won't wait forever.'
private_conversation_nov_2024.steve_reaction: nodded, said 'I know,' didn't change behavior - too overwhelmed with Nexus to process

what_jordan_wants.primary: undivided attention - even 2 hours per week of phone-down, work-talk-free presence would help
what_jordan_wants.secondary: wedding that happens - not about the event, about Steve choosing them over 'one more work thing'
what_jordan_wants.tertiary: acknowledgment of sacrifice - 'thank you for moving to Austin, I know that cost you' said with feeling, not passing comment
what_jordan_wants.underlying: partnership, not supporting role - want mutual support, not one-way caregiving for Steve's dreams

immediate.book_wedding_venue: even if Spring 2025, book something - demonstrates commitment, not hedging
immediate.one_weekend_fully_present: 48 hours phone off, no work talk, remember why they fell in love
immediate.acknowledge_jordan_sacrifice: name the cost of Austin move, wedding delays, lonely weekends - validate pain

ongoing.weekly_date_night_protected: Tuesday evenings, sacred, no cancellations except true emergency
ongoing.daily_connection_ritual: 20 minutes morning or evening, phone down, just talk - not about work
ongoing.include_jordan_in_life: tell Jordan about Marcus stress, Alex situation, runway crisis - let Jordan support instead of shutting out

structural.therapy_together: couples therapy to rebuild communication, Jordan can't be Steve's therapist and partner simultaneously
structural.post_series_a_plan: what does life look like when funding closes? Will Steve scale back to 50-hour weeks? Jordan needs to know this isn't forever
structural.boundaries_on_work: Steve sets work hours, protects weekend mornings, demonstrates Jordan matters more than Slack messages

breaking_point_timeline.current_state_dec_2024: Jordan at 7/10 on leaving scale - hurt, tired, questioning, but not gone yet
breaking_point_timeline.third_wedding_delay: if Steve pushes Spring 2025 wedding, Jordan moves to 9/10 - that's the pattern confirmation
breaking_point_timeline.six_more_months_like_this: if nothing changes by June 2025, Jordan starts apartment searching - can't do another year
breaking_point_timeline.steve_has_no_idea: thinks relationship is 'fine, just stressed from work' - doesn't see Jordan's slow exit
breaking_point_timeline.jordan_not_threatening: won't give ultimatum because that's not their style, will just quietly leave when threshold crossed

core_wounds.primary: fear of being unworthy of prioritization - wedding delays reinforce 'I'm not enough to choose'
core_wounds.secondary: lost sense of self in Steve's orbit - moved cities, delayed dreams, became support character in Steve's story
core_wounds.hidden: therapist wound - helps everyone else, no one helps them, Steve supposed to be person who holds Jordan's weight but he's too heavy with own

core_strengths.emotional_intelligence: reads Steve's stress, understands startup pressure, extends compassion beyond what most partners would
core_strengths.independence: has own thriving career, doesn't need Steve financially, chooses to stay out of love not necessity
core_strengths.communication_skills: names feelings clearly, asks for needs directly, creates space for hard conversations
core_strengths.patience: has waited through FlowMetric collapse, Nexus launch, two wedding delays - extraordinary endurance

steve_context_integration.non_negotiable_per_apex: operational rules state Jordan is non-negotiable, Steve cannot ghost Jordan
steve_context_integration.maria_knows_jordan_close_to_leaving: Maria mediates between them, sees both sides, worried
steve_context_integration.runway_crisis_makes_worse: Steve's stress about Nexus makes him less available for Jordan, vicious cycle
steve_context_integration.wedding_spring_2025_critical: if Steve delays third time, relationship probably ends
steve_context_integration.jordan_unspoken_test: watching if Steve will choose them over Series A pressure - answer determines everything

apex_should_reference_when: Steve canceling date night for work - 'Operational rules: cannot ghost Jordan. This is ghosting. Reschedule the Slack message, not the date.'
Steve considering third wedding delay - 'Two delays is circumstance. Three is pattern. You'll lose them. Book the venue or admit you don't want to marry them.'
Steve compartmentalizing relationship stress - 'Jordan is at breaking point. Maria told you. You nodded. You did nothing. Fix it before they leave.'
Steve justifying work priority - 'Carlos worked 35 years for you. Jordan moved cities, delayed wedding twice, waits alone on weekends. Who's sacrificing more?'
Steve needs reminder what matters - 'If Nexus succeeds and Jordan leaves, you failed. If Nexus fails and Jordan stays, you won. Prioritize accordingly.'
